item.title: Rubbish, 6th February
item.description:
These items have been left in the stream and by the edge of the stream near the little bridge for a couple months now. Really needs to be tidied up

item.title: Toxic waste fumes, 6th February
item.description:
Weve had a leak since last november .then a repair man dismantaled a pipe out side our flat the toxic fumes have made me and husband sick ,had to call ambulance our housing ass just dont seem bothered ,they moved a family out next door ,but left us as we are vunarable husband has cancer .the smell is in the flat we cant eat have to eat out could someone from enviromental health come out to check the leavels we left all doors windows open to help

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Kimpton Road, Camberwell, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Ongoing Illegal All-Day Parking in 30-Minute Bays – Daily Enforcement Failure, 6th February
item.description:
Vehicles belonging to local businesses are parking all day in designated 30-minute short-stay bays on a daily basis. The same vehicles remain for many hours in clear breach of the parking restrictions. Despite this being a daily issue, enforcement officers regularly ignore these ongoing violations and no Penalty Charge Notices are being issued. This has resulted in continued abuse of short-stay bays and loss of access for residents, customers, and deliveries. This is an ongoing and repeated enforcement concern rather than isolated incidents. Daily photographic evidence will continue to be uploaded to document repeated breaches and lack of enforcement.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 13-15, Plough Way, Rotherhithe, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Leaf debris / mulch in road and gutter., 6th February
item.description:
Kempton Close has leaf debris from a large tree that has turned into mulch on the road and in the gutters. This debris is slippery underfoot when walking or getting in a car. It is washing along the gutters into the drains and likely to cause blockages. Thank you.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Kempton Close, Northumberland Heath, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: West Heath Road, 5th February
item.description:
Unmarked pothole. 20.45 on 5.2.26.Car fron Left wheel fell into this and tyre burst. I am a Hospital Dr.and had to be late for my work, this is the seckond time in 2 months at night this very large hole has been hidden. On this occasion it destroyed my tyre.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): West Heath Road, West Hampstead, Greater London

item.title: 15 inch pothole, 5th February
item.description:
There is a 15 inch pothole on Houndsditch street near the Pret and The Alice pub at Aldgate. The pothole is deep enough to damage tyres. 2 of our tyres were damaged and went flat immediately. We had to call emergency services to come and replace the tyres.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 138, Houndsditch, City of London
Report on FixMyStreet
